summary: The Secretary of Homeland Security may designate a foreign country for Temporary Protected Status if conditions prevent the country’s nationals from returning safely. Under this status, eligible foreign nationals can temporarily stay and work in the U.S. Work authorization lasts as long as the status, but the documents proving it can expire. The Department of Homeland Security gives extensions and recently notified people about them...
title: Temporary Protected Status: Steps Taken to Inform and Communicate Secretary of Homeland Security's Decisions
